properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 7 at 6:34AM PST until January 8 at 12:15AM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a flood warning
for the following rivers in Washington...

North Fork Stillaguamish River Near Arlington affecting Snohomish
County
Pilchuck River Near Snohomish affecting Snohomish County

Heavy rain in the central Cascades Monday night into Tuesday morning
will cause the North Fork of the Stillaguamish and the Pilchuck River
near Snohomish in Snohomish county to go over flood stage this morning.
The rivers will begin receding this afternoon and fall back below
flood stage late this afternoon or tonight.

The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Pilchuck River Near Snohomish
* from this morning to late tonight.
* At  6:00 AM Tuesday the stage was 16.7 feet.
* Flood stage is 18.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage around 10 AM
Tuesday and crest near 18.3 feet around 1 PM Tuesday. The river
will fall below flood stage late this afternoon.
* Impact...At 18.0 feet, the Pilchuck River spills out of its banks...
flooding residences and roads in low lying areas along the river
from Granite Falls downstream through the Lake Stevens area and
Snohomish. This includes areas around Sexton Rd. and Orchard Ave in
Snohomish.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
